unnormalised: I remember when my chacha, Rajesh Sharma, first considered taking out a loan. He was a small-time businessman in Meerut, running a kirana store, and he wanted to expand. He’d heard about Mudra loans and other schemes, but honestly, he was quite apprehensive. He kept saying, "Interest rates toh bahut zyada hote hain, bhai!" (Interest rates are very high, brother!).
normalised: I remember when my chacha, Rajesh Sharma, first considered taking out a loan. He was a small-time businessman in Meerut, running a kirana store, and he wanted to expand. He’d heard about Mudra loans and other schemes, but honestly, he was quite apprehensive. He kept saying, "Interest rates toh bahut zyada hote hain, bhai!" (Interest rates are very high, brother!).

unnormalised: His main concern was the paperwork. He wasn’t very comfortable with filling forms, especially online. "Yeh sab online ka chakkar mujhe samajh nahi aata," he’d say, "I don't understand this whole online thing." Plus, he was worried about hidden charges. He'd heard stories from other shopkeepers about processing fees, late payment penalties, and all sorts of fine print he feared he wouldn't understand.
normalised: His main concern was the paperwork. He wasn’t very comfortable with filling forms, especially online. "Yeh sab online ka chakkar mujhe samajh nahi aata," he’d say, "I don't understand this whole online thing." Plus, he was worried about hidden charges. He'd heard stories from other shopkeepers about processing fees, late payment penalties, and all sorts of fine print he feared he wouldn't understand.

unnormalised: He initially approached a local cooperative bank. They offered him a loan at 12.5% interest p.a., but the collateral requirement was a bit steep. He needed to put up his house as security, which he wasn’t keen on doing. He also looked into a loan from SBI (State Bank of India), but the process seemed daunting. He said, "SBI mein toh line mein khade khade umar nikal jaati hai!" (You spend your whole life standing in line at SBI!). He didn't have a stellar CIBIL score either, it was around 650, which didn't help.
normalised: He initially approached a local cooperative bank. They offered him a loan at twelve point five percent interest per annum, but the collateral requirement was a bit steep. He needed to put up his house as security, which he wasn’t keen on doing. He also looked into a loan from S-B-I (State Bank of India), but the process seemed daunting. He said, "S-B-I mein toh line mein khade khade umar nikal jaati hai!" (You spend your whole life standing in line at S-B-I!). He didn't have a stellar C-I-B-I-L score either, it was around six hundred and fifty, which didn't help.

unnormalised: Finally, a friend told him about a NBFC offering quick loans. The interest was slightly higher, around 14% p.a., but the application process was much simpler. They only needed his Aadhaar card, PAN card, and bank statements for the last 6 months. And the loan was disbursed within 48 hrs! He took a loan of Rs. 2,00,000.
normalised: Finally, a friend told him about a N-B-F-C offering quick loans. The interest was slightly higher, around fourteen percent per annum, but the application process was much simpler. They only needed his Aadhaar card, P-A-N card, and bank statements for the last six months. And the loan was disbursed within forty eight hours! He took a loan of rupee two hundred thousand.

unnormalised: He used the loan to stock up on more variety of goods, installed a small computer for billing, and even added a delivery service. Business improved significantly. He was able to repay the loan in 2 yrs. He felt so relieved when he made the final payment.
normalised: He used the loan to stock up on more variety of goods, installed a small computer for billing, and even added a delivery service. Business improved significantly. He was able to repay the loan in two years. He felt so relieved when he made the final payment.

unnormalised: Now, he's planning to take another loan, but this time he’s aiming for a lower interest rate by improving his CIBIL score. He says, "This time, I'll be better prepared!" He is comparing loan options offered by various banks. He saw a promotional offer by HDFC bank with interest starting at 8.75%. His goal is to get under 9% interest, and he is working towards it.
normalised: Now, he's planning to take another loan, but this time he’s aiming for a lower interest rate by improving his C-I-B-I-L score. He says, "This time, I'll be better prepared!" He is comparing loan options offered by various banks. He saw a promotional offer by H-D-F-C bank with interest starting at eight point seven five percent. His goal is to get under nine percent interest, and he is working towards it.

unnormalised: My chacha's story taught me that loans can be helpful, but it's crucial to understand the terms, interest rates, and repayment schedules. Always compare different options, read the fine print carefully, and make sure you can afford the EMIs. He preponed payments by a week to be on the safer side! Don't be afraid to ask questions and seek help from financial advisors if needed. It is important to do the math before getting into something that can be taxing later.
